reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: WMD Commodity Identification Training; Dual-use licensing workshops; Enterprise Outreach workshops. Export Control Capacity Building with Chinese government agencies

description.narrative: Strengthen the global community's ability to safely destroy, store, apply safeguards to, and transport weapons of mass destruction (WMD) and secure related facilities and materials; control borders and territory to prevent illicit movement of WMD and related materials and technology and to prosecute and punish violators; prevent the proliferation of WMD and related materials, technology, and expertise to states or non-state actors of concern or to potential terrorists; comply fully with international obligations concerning arms control, nonproliferation, and WMD terrorism; deter and prevent WMD terrorism; and respond to a WMD terrorism event.

This award strives to strengthen the global community's ability to safely destroy, store, apply safeguards to, and transport weapons of mass destruction (WMD) and secure related facilities and materials. More specifically, this includes Award Description - Provide export Control capacity building workshop for Chinese officials. WMD Commodity Identification Training; Dual-use licensing workshops; Enterprise Outreach workshops.

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: U.S.~assistance helps Tibetan communities improve livelihoods, promote sustainable development and environmental conservation, and preserve cultural traditions. In addition, foreign assistance funding also supports targeted programs that strengthen cooperation on combatting the spread of HIV/AIDS and other pandemic and emerging diseases as well as rule of law programs.
Transfer of funds to U.S. National Laboratories
